<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/02/biz-world-keeping-close-eye-iowa-caucuses?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Iowant to Talk About Politics
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Two people looking at an election map of Iowa " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwNjY2NjU4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mark Makela/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, Iowans will head to libraries, schools, and church basements to cast the 2020 election’s very first votes in the <a href="https://www.politico.com/interactives/2020/iowa-caucus-how-they-work/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Iowa caucuses</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because the outcome of the election will (obviously) <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-30/the-inverting-yield-curve-is-about-more-than-recession-this-time?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">affect the economy</a>, biz analysts’ ears are pricked. One surprise? On the surface, President Trump’s approach to some issues isn't all that different from the stances of the leftier Democrats. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Trade, the deficit, and taxes   </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On trade: </strong>Both Sens. Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren, the Democratic Party’s left flank, are free trade skeptics (both, for example, opposed former President Obama’s TPP trade deal). Their hawkish positions on trade with China might not look too different from President Trump’s. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Warren’s chances in Iowa don’t look good, but Sanders took the lead in some recent polls. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On the deficit: </strong>A Sanders adviser said it’s safe to add $500 billion to the federal deficit to pay for education and fighting climate change. The White House is already planning another round of tax cuts after the election, 2020’s projected $1 trillion deficit notwithstanding. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On taxes: </strong>Okay fine, President Trump and the Dems don't really have anything in common here. Warren and Sanders would tax the gold-plated bejesus out of the nation’s wealthiest people and corporations to fund their initiatives. Trump’s 2017 tax cut lowered the corporate tax rate to 21% from 35% and granted bigger exemptions to rich Americans’ wealth-building vehicles of choice, like estates. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Colony Club dinners are going to get awkward. On Saturday, former NYC Mayor and presidential candidate Mike Bloomberg </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/michael-bloomberg-tax-plan-warren-sanders-biden-8a2c5b8e-0fd3-4f04-8ab0-12a89c4f0fcd.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rolled out a plan</a></span><span> to raise taxes on wealthy Americans and corporations. He’d add a 5% surtax on annual incomes over $5 million to help generate $5 trillion for his policy agenda. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then there’s former Vice President Joe Biden, the moderate Democratic frontrunner. As a longtime deficit hawk and free trade advocate, he’d be more likely to dial back tariffs and at the very least give the deficit a passing glance.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> With nine months before Election Day, investors are already taking cover from political risk in safe-haven assets like Treasuries. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><strong style="color:#000">+ Want to keep up with the election, how it shapes the biz world, and vice versa?</strong> Subscribe to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-turnout/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=turnout&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Turnout</a>, Morning Brew’s weekly biz/politics newsletter.</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/02/chinese-stock-market-slides-coronavirus-anxieties?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Chinese Stock Market Reopens, Immediately Regrets Decision
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Chinese stock market opened <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/03/coronavirus-latest-updates-china-hubei-wuhan-cases.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than 8% lower</a> as investors bit their nails over the coronavirus outbreak and its implications for the country’s economy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Markets had been closed since Jan. 23 for the Lunar New Year holiday, but...it wasn’t much of a holiday. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More than 360 people have died and over 17,000 have been infected worldwide. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Officials on Sunday confirmed a coronavirus-related death in the Philippines—the first outside of China. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chinese central bankers knew this sell-off was coming, so they injected an unprecedented <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-cenbank/china-to-inject-174-billion-of-liquidity-on-february-3-as-markets-reopen-idUSKBN1ZW074?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$174 billion of liquidity</a> into markets to try and stabilize them.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The broader economic impacts of the outbreak are still being hashed out. White House economists are reportedly busy crunching the numbers, while other experts think the health emergency could knock Chinese GDP growth in the first quarter below 5%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">While we’re here: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Apple is </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-apple/apple-to-close-all-china-mainland-stores-due-to-virus-outbreak-idUSKBN1ZV3F5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closing</a></span><span> all of its stores and corporate offices in mainland China through Feb. 9. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Chinese city of Wuhan, where the virus is believed to have originated, is building hospitals to accommodate the influx of patients. Construction timeline: two weeks.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1580658422.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="726" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em>Stringer/Getty Images</em></sup></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/02/wework-taps-sandeep-mathrani-ceo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A New Captain for SS WeWork
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Gif of a WeWork vacuum " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1580656678.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Gif of a WeWork vacuum " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1580656678.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New year, new beverage policy, new CEO. On Saturday, WeWork <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-wework-ceo/wework-names-real-estate-industry-veteran-mathrani-as-ceo-idUSKBN1ZV3WY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> real estate exec Sandeep Mathrani will be its new chief. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details:</strong> Mathrani will take over for Sebastian Gunningham and Artie Minson, who have been subbing in as co-CEOs since former CEO and founder Adam Neumann’s departure last fall. Mathrani will report to chairman Marcelo Claure, who recruited him through persistent LinkedIn DMs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>After a catastrophic 2019, WeWork is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/wework-parent-to-name-real-estate-veteran-sandeep-mathrani-new-ceo-11580576820?mod=hp_lead_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">getting back</a> to first principles. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Principle 1: Real estate. Mathrani used to run Brookfield </span><span><span>Property Partners’ retail group, one of the U.S.' largest mall owners</span></span><span>. His presence signals WeWork will focus on bread-and-butter office leasing, as opposed to the Neumann-era positioning as a consciousness-elevating tech company...that also runs a school for some reason. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Principle 2: Profitability. WeWork has sustained huge losses driven by massive spending for years, and hasn’t come within sniffing distance of profitability. Mathrani and Claure will be responsible for nursing the company's financial health. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Mathrani starts on Feb. 18.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/02/average-age-fortune-500-ceos-increased-recently?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No Rookies Wanted
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WeWork's not the only company replacing a young hotshot with a grizzled vet. As this <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/corporate-america-ceos-are-getting-older-mostly-white-2019-10?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">chart from Business Insider</a> shows, the average age at hire for bigtime CEOs has skyrocketed in recent years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://i.insider.com/5dbb55442f364a6385466849?width=1300&format=jpeg&auto=webp" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="ceo age v2"> </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you thought January felt long, wait until you hear about February. It has 29 days this year. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Trade balance report; earnings (Merck, GM, GlaxoSmithKline, Qualcomm, GoPro) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Earnings (Bristol-Myers Squibb, Twitter, News Corp, Uber, Tyson Foods, Pinterest, Toyota, Activision Blizzard, Dunkin Brands) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>New Green Day album; Democratic presidential debate in NH; January jobs report</p>

This week will feature more earnings reports from major companies and close with the January jobs report. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEnergy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOPEC and its pals are considering having an \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-31/opec-kingpins-divided-on-need-for-urgent-response-to-virus?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eemergency meeting\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to figure out a response to downer oil prices. After falling almost 16% in January over coronavirus-related concerns, they’re at a six-month low.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\n2020\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/02/biz-world-keeping-close-eye-iowa-caucuses?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nIowant to Talk About Politics\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Two people looking at an election map of Iowa \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwNjY2NjU4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMark Makela/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, Iowans will head to libraries, schools, and church basements to cast the 2020 election’s very first votes in the \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/interactives/2020/iowa-caucus-how-they-work/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eIowa caucuses\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause the outcome of the election will (obviously) \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-30/the-inverting-yield-curve-is-about-more-than-recession-this-time?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaffect the economy\u003c/a\u003e, biz analysts’ ears are pricked. One surprise? On the surface, President Trump’s approach to some issues isn't all that different from the stances of the leftier Democrats. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTrade, the deficit, and taxes   \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn trade: \u003c/strong\u003eBoth Sens. Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren, the Democratic Party’s left flank, are free trade skeptics (both, for example, opposed former President Obama’s TPP trade deal). Their hawkish positions on trade with China might not look too different from President Trump’s. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWarren’s chances in Iowa don’t look good, but Sanders took the lead in some recent polls. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn the deficit: \u003c/strong\u003eA Sanders adviser said it’s safe to add $500 billion to the federal deficit to pay for education and fighting climate change. The White House is already planning another round of tax cuts after the election, 2020’s projected $1 trillion deficit notwithstanding. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn taxes: \u003c/strong\u003eOkay fine, President Trump and the Dems don't really have anything in common here. Warren and Sanders would tax the gold-plated bejesus out of the nation’s wealthiest people and corporations to fund their initiatives. Trump’s 2017 tax cut lowered the corporate tax rate to 21% from 35% and granted bigger exemptions to rich Americans’ wealth-building vehicles of choice, like estates. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eColony Club dinners are going to get awkward. On Saturday, former NYC Mayor and presidential candidate Mike Bloomberg \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/michael-bloomberg-tax-plan-warren-sanders-biden-8a2c5b8e-0fd3-4f04-8ab0-12a89c4f0fcd.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erolled out a plan\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to raise taxes on wealthy Americans and corporations. He’d add a 5% surtax on annual incomes over $5 million to help generate $5 trillion for his policy agenda. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen there’s former Vice President Joe Biden, the moderate Democratic frontrunner. As a longtime deficit hawk and free trade advocate, he’d be more likely to dial back tariffs and at the very least give the deficit a passing glance.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e With nine months before Election Day, investors are already taking cover from political risk in safe-haven assets like Treasuries. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Chinese stock market opened \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/03/coronavirus-latest-updates-china-hubei-wuhan-cases.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than 8% lower\u003c/a\u003e as investors bit their nails over the coronavirus outbreak and its implications for the country’s economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMarkets had been closed since Jan. 23 for the Lunar New Year holiday, but...it wasn’t much of a holiday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore than 360 people have died and over 17,000 have been infected worldwide. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOfficials on Sunday confirmed a coronavirus-related death in the Philippines—the first outside of China. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChinese central bankers knew this sell-off was coming, so they injected an unprecedented \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-cenbank/china-to-inject-174-billion-of-liquidity-on-february-3-as-markets-reopen-idUSKBN1ZW074?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$174 billion of liquidity\u003c/a\u003e into markets to try and stabilize them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The broader economic impacts of the outbreak are still being hashed out. White House economists are reportedly busy crunching the numbers, while other experts think the health emergency could knock Chinese GDP growth in the first quarter below 5%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhile we’re here: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eApple is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-apple/apple-to-close-all-china-mainland-stores-due-to-virus-outbreak-idUSKBN1ZV3F5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosing\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e all of its stores and corporate offices in mainland China through Feb. 9. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Chinese city of Wuhan, where the virus is believed to have originated, is building hospitals to accommodate the influx of patients. Construction timeline: two weeks.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew year, new beverage policy, new CEO. On Saturday, WeWork \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-wework-ceo/wework-names-real-estate-industry-veteran-mathrani-as-ceo-idUSKBN1ZV3WY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e real estate exec Sandeep Mathrani will be its new chief. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details:\u003c/strong\u003e Mathrani will take over for Sebastian Gunningham and Artie Minson, who have been subbing in as co-CEOs since former CEO and founder Adam Neumann’s departure last fall. Mathrani will report to chairman Marcelo Claure, who recruited him through persistent LinkedIn DMs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter a catastrophic 2019, WeWork is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/wework-parent-to-name-real-estate-veteran-sandeep-mathrani-new-ceo-11580576820?mod=hp_lead_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egetting back\u003c/a\u003e to first principles. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePrinciple 1: Real estate. Mathrani used to run Brookfield \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eProperty Partners’ retail group, one of the U.S.' largest mall owners\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. His presence signals WeWork will focus on bread-and-butter office leasing, as opposed to the Neumann-era positioning as a consciousness-elevating tech company...that also runs a school for some reason. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePrinciple 2: Profitability. WeWork has sustained huge losses driven by massive spending for years, and hasn’t come within sniffing distance of profitability. Mathrani and Claure will be responsible for nursing the company's financial health. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eMathrani starts on Feb. 18.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F02%2Fwework-taps-sandeep-mathrani-ceo\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
